<title level="1" right="Rules">[Concealed](/Rules.aspx?ID=2419)</title>

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 434 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
A [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=62) creature is in mist, within [dim light](/Rules.aspx?ID=2403), or amid something else that obscures sight but isn’t a physical barrier. When you target a creature that’s concealed from you, you must attempt a DC 5 flat check before you roll to determine your effect. If you fail, you don’t affect the target. The concealed condition doesn’t change which of the main categories of detection apply. A creature in a light fog bank is still observed even though it’s concealed.
</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>
